This `symbol-cli` package provides with a command line interface to interact with the Symbol platform. The aim of this package is to facilitate the access a Symbol network through a standard terminal solution / command line interface.

This software can be used to create new accounts, prepare transactions, announce transactions and read blockchain data from Symbol API nodes. It uses nodejs and clime under the hood which permits usage on Windows, MacOS and Linux.

* Installation: https://nemtech.github.io/getting-started/setup-workstation.html
* CLI reference: https://nemtech.github.io/cli.html

The review of features can be grouped in following sub items:

* Review wallet / profile storage encryption
* Review connection handlers / websocket and HTTP connections

Releases: https://github.com/nemtech/symbol-cli/releases

The following features are currently out of scope:

* Any items related to the `test` and `travis` directories which are used for testing and development

==NOTE: latest release updated 3/17/2020, v0.9.6-beta2==

The entire release history can be found at:

https://github.com/nemfoundation/symbol-desktop-wallet/releases


The Symbol desktop wallet is the main client application for connecting to Symbol based blockchain networks.  The wallet application is a primary way end users will create accounts (key pairs), and interact with networks to submit transactions and read their account history.

The wallet is written as a VueJS[https://github.com/vuejs] application and packaged as an electron[https://github.com/electron] application so it can run on both Windows and OSX operating systems.  During our current development and testing phase we will be producing regular updates and builds about once every week on average.

The application leverages the official SDK for network communication, transaction creation, and private key wallets encryption. [(https://github.com/nemtech/symbol-sdk-typescript-javascript) symbol-sdk-typescript-javascript].

Bugs and known issues identified by the teams can be found in the repository issues [https://github.com/nemfoundation/symbol-desktop-wallet/issues]. 

## Setup

There are a few basic setup steps to get going with your testing set up

### Download & Install

From the releases page install (or update) to the latest version:

https://github.com/nemfoundation/symbol-desktop-wallet/releases

### Create an initial account

After installing and first launch you will be required to create an initial account.  The wallet uses BIP32 and a mnemonic phrase approach by default to generating unique key pairs for your account.  If you are not familiar with BIP32 or mnemonic phrases do not worry, the wallet will take you through the setup steps.

NOTE: for all testing as part of this scope you will use the TEST_NET “network type”.  The wallet is pre-setup to connect to our running test network so once your account is created you will not have to worry about connecting to specific nodes in the network.

### Get tokens from the faucet

After your account is set up and you are in the wallet you will need to acquire some base token funds in order to make various test transactions via the wallet.  We have two “faucets” set up for your usage:

http://faucet-01.symboldev.network/
http://faucet-02.symboldev.network/

They are both the same, two are run in case at any given time one is down we have a back up waiting for you.  You can enter our generated account address and enter the amount of funds to receive.

### Application features:

#### Account login and import

* Login page
  * HD wallet creation / import from mnemonic passphrase
* Wallet page
  * Seed wallets creation (up to 10)
  * Private key wallet import / export
  * Mnemonic passphrase export
* [Transfer features] (https://nemtech.github.io/concepts/transfer-transaction.html)
  * Send to an alias
  * Send several mosaics at one time
  * Send messages
  * Initiate multi signature transfers
* [Mosaics features] (https://nemtech.github.io/concepts/mosaic.html)
  * Create mosaics
  * Update mosaics supply (when applicable)
  * Bind / Unbind aliases to mosaics
* [Namespaces features] (https://nemtech.github.io/concepts/namespace.html)
  * Create namespaces and sub namespaces
  * Bind / Unbind namespaces to addresses and mosaics
* [Multisignature features] (https://nemtech.github.io/concepts/multisig-account.html)
  * Convert accounts to multisig accounts
  * Edit the rules of existing multisig accounts
  * Co-sign multisig transactions
* News
  * View of https://nemflash.io/ RSS feed

## Out of scope features

The following features are currently out of scope:

*  Hardware wallet features (Trezor, Ledger)
*  Crypto market features
*  Offline settings
* Any items related to the `__tests__` and `__mocks__` directories which are used for testing and development

This `symbol-hd-wallets` package provides with a layer for the generation of hierarchical deterministic wallets in the Symbol platform, inspired from the BIP44, BIP32 and BIP39 Bitcoin Improvement Proposal Suite. The aim of this package is to improve cross-client compatibility with regards to Wallet generation, backup of accounts, and account derivation.

A noteable difference with the Bitcoin HD Wallets implementation is that Symbol uses ED25519 and therefor does not permit `public parent key` to `public child key` generation. Additionally this library limits the available derivation paths to **hardened child paths only**.

Wallet Scenario: https://hackerone.box.com/s/0v781yycpzh1uoeuz467f68tqp9tv71d

The review of features can be grouped in following sub items:

* Review MnemonicPassPhrase.toSeed() password encryption
* Review ExtendedKey.fromSeed() password decryption
* Review implementation of hardened-only BIP32/44 key derivation
* Review master account and child account derivation (+ derivation paths)

The following features are currently out of scope:

* Any items related to the `test` directory which is used for testing and development

This `symbol-qr-library` package provides with a layer for the generation of different QR Codes on the Symbol platform. The aim of this package is to improve cross-client compatibility with regards to QR Code generation.

QR Codes can be created to represent several objects related to Symbol technology, as such it is possible to create one of: AccountQR, ContactQR, CosignatureQR, MnemonicQR and TransactionQR. Each of these specialized QR Codes contain different data schemas.

The review of features can be grouped in following sub items:

* Review base64 encoding of QR-codes in QRCode.toBase64()
* Review QRCodeGenerator.fromJSON initialization and configuration
* Review AES with PBKDF2 encryption in EncryptionService.encrypt
* Review AES with PBKDF2 decryption in EncryptionService.decrypt
* Review 8-bit encoding (binary) within QRCode.build method

The following features are currently out of scope:

* Any items related to the `test` directory which is used for testing and development

Visma Connect is featurewise a small but critical component in the Visma portfolio. It is a single sign-on solution used by many Visma services. It is also the place where users manage security preferences such as passwords, MFA, 2FA, email and other account settings.

User accounts for testing can be created on https://connect.identity.stagaws.visma.com (this signup flow is not available in production).

The test accounts will not have access to any other services right now, so testing is limited to the login portal itself. In the upcoming months we will add several large services to the scope which will use the Visma Connect portal as a common authentication platform.

Out of scope: 
            - Session invalidation during password change - this bug is known and the team is working on a fix.
            - Session invalidation after enabling 2FA - by design intended to work like this.

This is "Visma eAccounting" (aka Visma eEkonomi / Visma ePasseli) which is an ERP system available in Sweden, Norway, Finland and The Netherlands.

You can read more on https://www.visma.no/eaccounting/english/

You need to register an user to test this system. The sign-up up process is described in this document:

https://vismabugbountyprod.z16.web.core.windows.net/Visma-eAccounting-hackerone-getting-started.pdf

This video also shows the entire setup (only Swedish audio) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kVr_CXgfhi0&t=4s

TLDR: Goto https://admin.stage.vismaonline.com/Customer/StudentSignup.aspx?country=en&uilang=en&companyId= and sign up with the training code "04h2v"

**Out of scope:**
 - Session invalidation issues (e.g. logout, password change, email change, role change, user deletion, etc).
- Modification of gray-out fields when logged in with an admin account.
- Improper access control: manipulation of the message conversation by members that have no permission (edit subject, join thread conversation, closing the conversation).
You reach this asset by creating and viewing a report under the Accounting/Reports menu as a logged on user in asset 'eaccounting.stage.vismaonline.com'.

#Bor
The Bor node or the Block Producer implementation is basically the sidechain operator. The sidechain VM is EVM-compatible.

#Contracts
This repository contains the smart contracts that power Matic Network

#Heimdall 
This github repository contains the source code for one of the core components of Matic. Heimdall is the heart of the Matic system. It manages validators, block producer selection, spans, the state-sync mechanism between Ethereum and Matic and other essential aspects of the system.
